lines: A famous dairy products company is sponsoring a baking contest at your school. The first prize is a new bicycle and a trip to Disneyworld. Your mother is the world's best cheese cake baker. You know that getting her to bake the cake
for you would certainly tip the chances of winning the contest in your favor.
#GET YOUR MOTHER TO BAKE THE CAKE FOR YOU
*selectable_if (false) #DO NOT ENTER THE CONTEST AT ALL

#DO NOT ENTER THE CONTEST AT ALL

You tell your mother that there is a bake sale for charity at school, and ask her if she would help you by baking a cake. She agrees. You bring the cake to school and enter it into the contest. As a result:
You win the contest. Everyone is in awe of your baking skills. The bicycle is presented to you and you are told that you can take the Disneyworld visit whenever you wish. How do you feel?

At first everyone is shocked. They can't believe you would do such a thing. Of course, you will have to give the bicycle and the trip back. One positive thing about the whole incident is that after things simmer down, people respect you
for being honest in the end.

You are developing an early knack for being sneaky and underhanded. I'm sure you will come up with convinving lies to explain how you got the bicycle and the trip. Now you had just better hope that none of your teachers mention your

Can't bring yourself to face the music, eh? Eventually your lies catch up to you. You find it too difficult to explain where you got the bike, and how you won the free trip. You are disgraced in front of your family and friends. I hope
this experience has taught you a lesson.
Melissa Baker wins the contest with her homemade ice cream cake. Some of the teachers suspect that you did not make the cake yourself and mention it to your mother. You are grounded for a week.

You try very hard to duplicate your mother's cake. It comes out very tasty, but is not good enough to win the contest. Your family is proud of your independence and your effort. Trustworthiness and Familial scores rise.
I guess entering a baking contest doesn't do much for you right now.
